news.title: UK's third-largest steelworks collapses into government control
news.summary: Hundreds of Liberty Steel workers in Rotherham and Sheffield face an uncertain future.

news.title: Five key takeaways from this year's GCSE results
news.summary: The GCSE pass rate has fallen again this year. Here's what you need to know.

news.title: Record 111,000 UK asylum applications in past year, figures show
news.summary: The latest data, which covers Labour's first year in office, also shows the government is processing cases faster.

news.title: 'Slave-like' assistants and late-night massages: How a radical priest abused his congregation
news.summary: Chris Brain, who led nightclub-style services in the 1980s and 90s, is convicted of indecent assault.

news.title: Appeals court throws out Trump's $500m civil fraud penalty
news.summary: In its 323-page ruling, the New York judges stated that the fine was excessive, and likely violated the US Constitution.

news.title: Game of Thrones star Kristian Nairn withdraws from Strictly due to stress-related illness
news.summary: Kristian Nairn says he's been struggling with "a high level of stress and a little bit of grief".

news.title: Councillor's wife jailed for race hate social media post released from prison
news.summary: Lucy Connolly is released from HMP Peterborough after receiving a 31-month sentence in October.

news.title: Russia launches biggest wave of strikes on Ukraine for weeks
news.summary: Ukrainian officials say the attacks included drones, hypersonic, ballistic, and cruise missiles.

news.title: Hundreds of thousands of Grok chats exposed in Google results
news.summary: Elon Musk's artificial intelligence (AI) chatbot appears to have published messages without users' knowledge.

news.title: UK backs call for Israel to allow foreign media into Gaza
news.summary: Governments from 27 countries, including France and Germany, say journalists in Gaza must be protected.
